_description: Charm for sprained or dislocated wrists or ankles — rough couplets and a triplet

HunHM64.Transcription:
Oure lorde Ihesu criste ouere a don roodeAnd his foole
                    sloodeAnd owre lorde criste aboodeAnd layde lithe to lithe And
                    flesshe to flesshe And bone to boneAnd com hym to booteI praye
                    criste Ihesu so this moote
HunHM64.Note:
Followed by prose instructions: ‘And in the name of thee fader
                    & sonn & the holy goste saye this charme 3es and at euery
                    tyme saye a pater noster aue marie & crede’ (f.
                    145ra).
HunHM64.Attributed Title:
For armes or legges that ar myswreyght say thes wordes (f.
                    145ra)
HunHM64.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 249-50.
